9zSV0aXzPtS6dmUZ56vAjQ.text: I feel like its name suits this place, as it's rather fortuitously decked out as a sanctuary to catch up on those eponymous founts of knowledge - or let's be honest, random laptopping - with the food incidental to the experience.not that the food is bad, but I just don't feel like that's the raison d'etre of this place. to be fair - it's all pretty decent. my pancakes were just about fluffy enough, with a dash of powdered sugar and sliced fruit; eggs benedict as you'd expect, with flowy yolks and a rather cute addition of a latke; and an unphotographed order of cereal was a rather out-the-box execution of muesli, generic sweetened vanilla yogurt and milk.so it's all edible, but not exactly travel-worthy.the calm of the place is more than worth it though. it's hidden away in the outskirts of robertson quay (as though our red dot is large enough to quantify for this term), and almost completely rid of any hipsters - money can't buy that second part these days. it's not cool so much as cozy, with a smart layout of sofas at the back and traditional table-and-chairs in front, as well as the books and magazines all propped up on shelves everywhere.get a coffee, and some food - support these people please - and while away your afternoon. it's like being home, without actually being home.

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. american-style pancakes with fruit and syrup

IsLmotDaBUtwGb1zj7IaYA.text: 'Let's go to Book Cafe today! Awww yeah I missed that place!" It's such a cozy hang out, perfect to chill on the couch and catch up on some emails, maybe even do a little bit of work. During the weekends it can be quite packed, but nobody seems to mind sharing a couch. You gotta accept a bit of PDA though, the crowd is a combination of couple's snuggling up to each other and having brunch or a coffee together, and the other half is couples composed of a person dating a laptop.Easy going vibes with Jack Johson and Enya are playing on the background and dim  lights. The services matches the music and is slow as well. Menu is quiet extensive and there's always something that can satisfy your needs. 15 dollar for a salad and 8 dollars for a iced mocha is a bit much though, but you are paying for the ambiance and for one of limited spots on the couches.

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

jFGjMAHljDaWKGNnMiQ9sA.text: Great place to hang out and complete assignments.The coffee is all right but I came here for the ambience,and this place is perfect for lounging during the afternoon with a book to read.

kVakxhgsFIZOhwLETmJYUg.text: This cafe was located across the street from our hotel so the location was perfect. They have an extensive menu so you can find something for everyone and a ton of books and games to keep you occupied.  The environment is very relaxed the service was great.  A good place for breakfast or a light meal.

pM7kFYPxURB4XnthnA6xIQ.text: Long-standing, well-loved cafe. Great place to read, chill, catch up plus free wifi. Decent coffee n food!

erp-nMWSQFd3H4hR1KgeZA.text: Probably some of the warmest service I've encountered in Singapore. Maybe it's because I'm almost a regular but I swear there are a few folks who work here who make me ok with paying the Bougieville prices. The cafe is very cute on the inside and has a much more homey, approachable feel than the usual pretentiousness that frequently comes when S'pore establishments try Western fare. The food is pretty solid also making this a definite go to place to get some work done, or just hang out with a cup of coffee and a good book!

oqUe-m9LCZf8RGL1uCNZ6Q.text: I was finding a place in between 2 appointments and had no laptop or books with me. The place is unexpectedly crowded with people hitting my chairs all the time. Nonetheless the traditional lemon cake is really good. I had it with Hot Honey Lemon. Perfect combination.

uVJcl0gJeLt_uy3U3JUhoA.text: A great place to get away from the fast pace of working life. Located near to robertson quay , this restaurant is pretty well hidden and offers customers a serene ambience to laze the afternoon.This would be an ideal place for you to chill and read a book, there's indoor and outdoor and there is a couch area indoor where you can read and dine. The shop also offers a great variety of books and magazines.I would recommend to have a set of egg benedict at the couch section, with a book to read through the afternoon, it would simply be sensational and mind refreshing.

8-cYLGvHO08PrAjHmoX1QA.text: I give it 2 stars for the free wifi and ambience but the service and food terrible. Took nearly an hour to get my brunch, staff running through the place as so busy. Very understaffed. My "extras" were a joke eg tomato was a single thin slice of uncooked tomato. Poached eggs overlooked and coffee good flavour but served cold, probably because they are too busy again. Use it for the wifi but avoid for anything else.expect a LONG wait.

Y1wXioJSjB6Pxv6CInagzg.text: Full marks for ambience, passing marks for menu, and brownie points for cheap wine. Spent quite a bit of time here one evening, and depending on the CD on repeat of the day, you can get crazies singing to Lady Gaga. Over and over again. Tres annoying. There are the studious types hunched over their laptops on the sofa, and the serious dinner crowd that prefers to sit at the proper tables. I was rather pleased with their $40 bottle of house white that was surprisingly drinkable. Would return just for this. Forget everything else edible. It's just that - forgettable. You'd be better off throwing a rock anywhere along Robertson Quay and scoring better food.

jFDAHPL9QfcRSUwHxS2glw.text: Had a nice salad here & glass of wine. Very chill, free wi-fi, and friendly staff. What's not to like?

w8nw3fV3V2Y3jNh1F2DIMQ.text: Book Cafe has always been one of my favorite places to hunker down with a book or a magazine with a cuppa, away from the madding crowd. I love that they are also one of the few places which serve breakfast all day.Food : Have been for brunch, dinner as well as late night coffee on different occasions, and have never once been disappointed. Have tried the pancakes and the fry up which consisted of hash brown, sausages, bacon, toast and eggs for brunch, cod and sandwiches for dinner, and last but not least, hot cocoa with marshmallows, mango smoothies and a variety of desserts i.e, apple pie, lemon and rosemary cake with Greek yogurt as well as pine nut pie (available only on weekends). Comfort cafe fare ... love it all.Service : Friendly and pleasant.Ambience : Laidback and cosy. Relaxing music. Love the sofas.Remains one of my favorite haunts.

F_3G4P1qHJMJTl4oKB82GQ.text: Hey. Lost in Singapore and looking for something a little bit "western " but not too much. The best grilled chicken sandwich I've had in years!!  Great ambiance and great wi-fi connection. Life is good. This place is great!!

p98HvbkaC2SiBlL1_23DFQ.text: Another great standby - consistently great service, personable atmosphere, great food and a place to read or chill out.

bG3998Y1JWNfaDts5dKs4g.text: Awesome tasty Cheese Burger- I love it!Wait staff was so nice too, very helpful and informative about each product. Wonderful experience. Wish I can go back next year trip.

mdN4hGqJ-Tze-MQdZUe-Og.text: The Book Cafe20 Martin RoadThere is a diversified range of reading materials available- several hundred local and foreign books, magazines and newspapers are available.Several couches indoors. Quite a lot of outdoor seats.There is wireless Internet access and also electrical power-points. Easy street-side parking right in front of the café.All-day breakfast.Egg RoyaleToasted English muffin + maple bacon (none today so replaced with usual bacon) + grilled tomatoes + baby spinach + poached eggs + hollandaise sauce + rotating potato - goodClassic Cheese BurgerGrilled beef patty + cheese + tomato slices + lettuce + caramelised onions on a toasted burger bun + fries - nice & juicyCalamansi Ice coffee

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Eggs Blackstone
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Cheese burger - nice and juicy. Thick slab of beef patty.
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Calamansi juice

RP3zJNDuKK1D-XpR3l_u7Q.text: Moseyed on into this cafe by chance from walking around the Quay. First impression stepping inside was the quietness of the place for a Sunday evening. One can get some serious work, reading or chill time accomplished in here. Sofa seating seemed cozy and inviting. Did I mention reading? As the cafe's name eludes to, there is a very large inventory of reading material for one's perusal. Free and fast WiFi (perhaps I visited when patrons weren't streaming). Order cheese cake slices and a flat white. Cheese cakes had a gummy texture to the surface layer, so maybe it wasn't as fresh as I expected. The flat white was very good. Double shot from some nice dark roasted beans and some milk ... nice cup of Joe to my liking! Average cafe with an extra star for stacks of reading material, less a star for mediocre cheese cakes.

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Crumble & Oreo cheesecakes
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Flat white
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. You can spend all day here

QYVrcULPiZAFdGZW1wSgpg.text: This isn't a cafe you come to specially for their food, but to read your book/surf net/work on your computer.There are heaps of reading materials in the interior, but we chose to sit outside. There are power outlets but you may have to fight other users for them. We got a pot of tea, coffee, pumpkin soup, and a slice of Oreo cheesecake to while the afternoon away. Wifi was a bit slow because it was crowded and it was a public holiday. On a normal day, it would probably be okay.Our food was okay, nothing special, but if you have the munchies while reading, they will be quelled.Service was prompt and our water glasses were rarely empty.

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

juyV58Fobpj9pmB6M0P-YQ.text: Book cafe is a wonderful place if you are looking for a pressure free place to read or get some work done. There is free WiFi, good coffee and desserts, as well as substantial food items  (though I personally haven't tried them).I had the iced latte and lemon pie both of which were sizeable and tasty. There is plenty of seating both indoor and outdoor  (with fans) for customers to stay however long.I will be back to try the food!

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

tz8ilU9x2ETKkv3UZHFMkA.text: I visited for brunch on a Saturday morning. The place wasn't full which was great, if you're looking for a place where you can have a conversation without shouting. At one side of the restaurant, there are couches that were perfect for relaxing with a good book. And books there were aplenty for you to browse with. The service staff were friendly and eager to please. Unfortunately, the food though decent, isn't good enough for me to specially return for it. I had the eggs blackstone (English muffin, spinach, tomatoes, eggs, rosti) and a flat white. The coffee was better than I expected - low in acidity. I was excited about the apple pie based on previous reviews, but it didn't live up to the hype. I prefer a harder crust; the filling had just the right hint of tartness and sweetness. My friend really enjoyed his chicken sandwich which he ordered based on the recommendation of another reviewer. It's a nice place to hang out with friends but if you're a picky eater, it may not live up to your expectations. Free wifi available. Toilet is very clean and orderly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

BDgJRjZLnmrDpqCURwWliA.text: My favorite local spot in Singapore. On a few occasions I spent about 4 continuous hours here working and studying. The staff is wonderful. I am always greeted with a friendly smile. The lemon pine nut pie (available only on fridays and weekends) is to die for. The flavors compliment each other so well and the presentation is beautiful. The eggs Royale and eggs Blackstone are also solid dishes to try here. The dragonfruit and pear juice is my personal favorite drink here. The iced Carmel latte also delicious on a hot day (which is literally every day in Singapore). Very unpretentious. I definitely recommend this spot.

7g3txEi-y44MuEggjsEItQ.text: A really nice coworking spot. There's plenty of tables inside and out, and a living room with couches if you're feeling more in Kindle mode.The coffee is good, but unremarkable given the high quality of Singapore coffee options, including Toby's Estate nearby.The food is pretty fantastic though; the Eggs Blackstone has a wonderful hollandaise and... maple bacon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Tons of seats for coworking
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Eggs Blackstone

sD-s6_qJiklxUTo61UcUlA.text: I'll admit I'm biased because I love anything book related.Let me try to be objective though.Came in on a Sunday for brunch (today, actually)Had smoked salmon set sans the salmon, because vegetarian. Flat white. Long black. My friend had the smoked salmon set and vouched for the edibility of the salmon, hot cocoa, and we shared a French toast set. Food was great, waiting time was Long, even though the place was not crowded. Worth the wait though. Price is average for cafes. Decent portion size.Music is old fashioned jazz-ish music. Not loud enough for me, but then again, to each their own. Service was great. Attentive, friendly, non-judgy even though my half-asleep brain asked weird questions about the menu. Bright enough for study/work/reading. They also have a great selection of books to read. If you're so inclined, it's a great place to transition from coffee to wine/beer. All in all, an experience I wouldn't mind repeating the next time I have an itch to be outside on a Sunday.

5ZRG9sXopax29Kq9sEFCmw.text: This place has a major fruit fly issue. Flies on my food, in my drink, just buzzing around everywhere. Had to go up to the counter to get served even though I was sat at a table with a menu. My avocado sandwich contained no avocado. Found a needle??? In the sofa. I was looking for a comfortable, chill place to study, unfortunately this wasn't it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Needle found in the couch.

ouKwmQushMJYA-dni9AMzA.text: Unlike those new kids on the block, The Book Cafe situated on the corner of Martin Road is a well-known, well-loved hideout for many book lovers, myself included. Throw in free fast-speed Wi-Fi, more than 10 socket plugs peppered around the place and dozens of foreign/local magazines for your reading pleasure and you have a café that is perpetually teeming with diners/readers every day of the week.Take your pick between square tables or lounge sofa seats, put up your feeds and chill-out for a few hours reading, gossiping, sipping a cuppa or whiling the time away people-watching.My fourth visit to the café saw me ordering their Traditional Apple Pie which did not disappoint at all; think soft, chewy, sweet apple bits hidden expertly within a thin, crispy, sugary crust with streaks of chocolate sauce on the side. I didn't order drinks this time as I came on a full stomach but on my previous visits, their Flat White left quite a good impression on me too.Packed with weekenders in casual wear during weekends and with businessmen on weekdays, The Book Café comes highly recommended if you're in the Havelock Road area and looking for a good place to recharge (self and electronics alike).

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

e5Ig-37qIRKdc4PnwUdhrQ.text: I must spend way to much time looking at Google Maps because when I discovered this place I knew that I had to check it out (especially being such a book nerd). All I can say is that it's reputation certainly lives up to its name with large bookshelves inside covered in books, as well as a number of covers of Lolita on one of the walls. I came here for breakfast (I simply wasn't interested in breakfast at my hotel, even though it was probably included in the price) and I must admit that it was pretty good, and the coffee wasn't all that bad either. This is one of those places that I could easily spend a few hours in every morning with a hot cup of tea and a nice book. The also have an outdoor section, though a part of that is a smoking area, though why would one want to sit outside when you can sit inside with all the marvellous books.

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Books Galore
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Lolita Posters
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Pots at the entrance

M99uJUkiVt0qmy9uZ_dmag.text: Just like any reviewed place, it depends on the time that one makes their visit. I've come to The Book Cafe several times before and most of the times in the past, it has been relatively crowded.  However, tonight, on a Wednesday evening at about 6:45pm, it is relatively quiet.  In fact, a lot of the sofas are still unoccupied. But that's probably about to change as some people come here for dinner, dessert, or drinks. This is the kind of cafe to come, relax and chill for awhile.  Half of the cafe space is simply an enclave of comfy sofas and shelves of magazines and books.  This is the kind of place you expect to spend at least an hour or two, or three...The prices are mid-range but that is to be expected, given the location.  It's walking distance from Robertson Quay, with its fancy restaurants and bars.  The Book Cafe offers a nice ambience for personal time; and even if you come with someone, you are able to each do your own thing while sitting comfortably side-by-side. This is on the short list of "must-visit" cafes in Singapore.

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Enough magazines to spend time with, not to mention books which are off-camera!
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. I'm seated in the enclave where the books and sofas are.
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Wow, when it's not crowded and there are actually seats available!

U5ci-VF50rIiBiLEaYJXbg.text: We went there for brunch on Sunday. We were hoping to do some reading and work a bit on the paperwork. They have the coziest sofa but when you sat for too long, believe me it was tiring as the table is too low. Hence we wish to change seats since there are plenty of tables outdoor. The PIC told us we shouldn't do that and seek for our understanding. My husband suggested to the waitress that we paid for the bills and we change table. But they insisted us to remain the seats,and once again hope us to understand. We were quite pissed off since plenty of tables still vacant..we decided to leave and will never return to this cafe again. Advice from us..if you all wish to visit this cafe please find a comfortable place or else you will not be able to change table again

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

1ergjxN3y3TYbMnhjr5Jqw.text: BREAKFAST/LUNCH:- eggs w/ bratwurst (~$15)- turkey, avocado, & egg white sandwich (~$15)FOOD: Simple. Consistent. Tasty. There's no mystery behind the menu here. They serve breakfast, salads, sandwiches, and entrees catered to the cafe crowd. They also have a lengthy tea and coffee selection. I came here for breakfast 3 days straight, and it's very satisfying. Food is well-seasoned and portions are appropriate. AMBIANCE: I like it because they don't try to hard. The place embodies the calming neighborhood vibe. There's a section with couches if you want to wind down for you drink/eat, and an outdoor seating area as well. I stayed for a couple hours on Sunday to work, and they were very accommodating. PRICE: Very reasonable all things considered. You can get a proper breakfast/meal + coffee for right around $20. OVERALL: Highly recommend this place to anyone living in the Robertson Quay area. Singapore in general could use a few more of these neighborhood joints. PS: +0.5 stars for doing takeaway

bEU6TGm0Gb6uHwYeQ7zbfg.text: Just a tiny bit out of the way, but worth it.  This is a great place for breakfast when staying in the area.

aD29mb9MBqiE035x7l_JQw.text: I sort of like this place. It's very cozy. Tons of magazines/books to peruse. Espresso is ok. That other one nearby is much better. On the dessert, I would stick to the pies which are "baked fresh daily". The others looked dropped off by some supermarket. Also another perk is the ample patio street space which is very shaded. Overall nice place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Costa level

8h43deYoxUAlMB7G2dRiaA.text: The Book Cafe, just another one of the lovely neighborhood cafes I will be frequenting in the Robertson quay area. The ambience of this place is very relaxing. They play some nice 50-60's old swing Motown blues, real soothing and conducive to the relaxing atmosphere.You could sit outside or inside, where I bet it's perfect to post up and do some work from home stuff. They a little living room library set up just next to the main dining area.Off the shelves are tons of magazines and periodicals for you to peruse during your stay. They even have my favorite, Monocle!As for food, I could only comment on breakfast as that's all I've had here the past two times. A set will set you back S$14 and that's your standard two eggs, some toast, hash browns and a meat of choice. Add in a coffee and you are looking at a little under S$20 all in.The service is very good at this place, real friendly and and attentive, but not overly.This place makes me want to come back and do some work. I may do that so i could test out the lunch specials.This will be one of my frequent neighborhood haunts!

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

05HE05M4tiGFKCzNFi2b6Q.text: Nice place. You will feel very relax in here. You can take time to read many books and magazines. The food is normal, not bad. If you want to find a cafe where give you relax feeling and long chart with you love and friends. Here will be your choice...

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Nice coffee

3QwW_saMt4MECRLyqg34zw.text: It's hard to find a place in Singapore that allows you to sit and do some work. This is a very nice cafe and very friendly staff. Good WiFi until it got a bit crowded, then it slowed down a bit. Lots of power outlets. Really great eggs benedict - simple with no frills but very well made hollandaise sauce.  Had a flat white (2 actually!) that did not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Flat white - nicely made!
Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Eggs benedict - very good!
